data.message: Way hey, way to go FB, this is amazing! Husband and I are battling with wifi in Mykonos just now...maybe need planes flying over places already connected for better coverage too!

replies.message: Thanks for sharing, Mike! We're glad to hear that you're as excited about it as we are. ;) -Jordan
Jordan - Glad there is a name behind FB...have terrible (and expensive "unbundable") wifi service on the Cali Central Coast...fly that puppy over my house any time...sounds like a great idea!
That plane is awesome. Good work FB. Congrats to the people who engineered and built the plane and the many hours it must have taken to reach your goal!!
Mike?
Cool...
Nice.... Really nice!!!!
Hahaha! Yeah thanks MIKE! BTW anyone seen Mark? 🤔🤔😂😂😂😂
He liked the video lol
Wow! Impressive
TECHNOLOGY IS WAY BEYOND ME....DON'T EVEN HAVE A I PHONE...BU DON'T NEED ONE WITH FACEBOOK..KEEP MOVING FORWARD MARK....
Im curious, when it does come time for it to land how do you get it down in onr piece?
sounds like a great invention but i have a question, if it is flying around isn't that going to make the internet go in and out because the reception will be either closer of farther away?
My one dryer... hydro anti  curl multi mist and curl again is the best..............
Love FB !!!!!!!!
Wow, that's amazing!

Joan Gandy has a very good question. And what is the range on your signals? Do you only have one plane or thousands? I get fairly good reception here in Kansas but I go down into the Missouri Ozarks & don't get anything. Will that plane be available in that area?
This is an outstanding invention, Is this available in Canada?
My cat5 cable is not long enough to reach it.  Please advise.
Very nice fb. ♡♡

How long do they remain airborne and are there enough to provide feasible rotation schedules to allow for proper maintenance routines?  This sounds very exciting.   I hope everything launches accordingly as expected.
You people actually think Facebook were the ones who designed, built and invented this aircraft? Lmao.
Probably not Andrew Givens, but when you put the money behind the project I'm pretty sure you own it!
You guys are Amazing! Connecting the world is a huge undertaking and the plane appears to be very stable. Also, massive kudos for the power consumption team! You guys Rock.
Yes, I need better coverage here in South Tucson.

Probably wasn't behind the project either. Facebook is infamous for buying out completed projects and then taking all the credit. 
It was probably Boeing, Grumman or some private company that built it, invented it and made it work. 

I say give credit where credit is due.
